Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <englal> @jimboscott When your wallet is created, it has a keypool of 100 or so addresses in it. Any time you request a new address to receive to, need a change address when you send funds, or solve a new block via PoW, it will select an unused address from that keypool, an address already in the wallet, and use it. Once it has been used it will show up in the wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Shaun> i have 3 pcs and update all my gui wallet form old wallet backup

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Shaun> But the data of each wallet are different, including quantity, transaction records.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Shaun> how to deal with that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <TexWiller> Your wallet uses a keypool: when it starts, it creates a bunch of keys and, for each transasction, one address is being used. If your wallet generates more key after a backup, they are not included in the old backup. How have you imported the backups?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[discord] <Shaun> i just backup my wallet.dat   
And then replace the new wallet file

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <TexWiller> if you make a backup at 10.00AM and your wallet mines a new block at 11.00AM using a new address (assuming that your previous addresses were all used), this block will not be in your backup. Also, to merge wallets, you can't copy multiple wallet.dat (each one is being overwrited by the other). Have a look in faq section, there's a procedure for merging (z_exportwallet & z_kmportwallet)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Shaun> ok thanks for your reply

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
seems I got my own answer for address with locked funds, seems funds are deposited on a "sort" of changeaddress. At least it isn't on main.
One question I have then : are those address derived from main one (the one generated with the priv), or just on the fly generated when mining is succesful : 
Derivative would mean reimporting just the priv could make it, but just on the fly would mean they re just locked in specific wallet.dat, then would have to collect all .dat from multiple mining machines waiting for a possible transfer to T-address. 

How does it really work then : Do we have to make regular backups of wallet.dat or just keeping the priv is enough ?

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: speaking with it with blackjok3r : seems it s a b address, waiting for the "contract" of mature comes to reality when the lock is reached, but could you confirm it ? that would mean only the priv is needed, and no need to keep multiple wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <miketout> It is not derived. It is a key pool, and the address listed on listttransactions is the address to save the privkey of. I believe TexWiller‚Äôs solution for dumping and merging wallets listed in faq-chosen is the most convenient way to merge wallets.

Author: Deleted User#0000

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <idrtis> lets say I have 100 staking VRSC and I send someone 10 VRSC, would I wait 150 blocks again for the staking for the rest 90 coins?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <miketout> @idrtis it's possible, but not necessarily so. the reason is that if you have one unspent transaction output (UTXO) that is 10 Verus, the other 90 would be untouched and continue staking. If you have one UTXO that is 100, 10 will go to the receiver, and the other 90 will also be sent to a change address, which will reset its age.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <idrtis> gotcha thanks
